title: Iran defies US pressure to abandon nuclear enrichment despite Trump threats | ABC NEWS
description: Iran is refusing to give up its uranium enrichment and ballistic missile programs despite pressure and war threats from the Trump administration.  Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says Tehran will not be intimidated after White House special envoy Steve Witkoff and Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner visited the USS Abraham Lincoln’s strike group in the Arabian Sea.  Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is meeting the US president to call for a tougher stance on Iranian ballistic missiles which can reach Israel in 15 minutes. title: Takaichi's coalition claims landslide victory in Japan’s snap election | ABC NEWS
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s coalition has cruised to a sweeping victory in the country’s snap election.  The conservative leader of the Liberal Democratic Party won her first election outright months after she replaced her predecessor Shigeru Ishiba.  Japan's 'Iron Lady' campaigned on strong economic reforms and a tougher approach to China. title: Thailand’s caretaker prime minister declares election victory as vote count continues | ABC NEWS
description: Thailand’s Interim Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul has declared victory in the country's election despite vote counting still taking place. The caretaker leader’s conservative Bhumjaithai Party surged in popularity over its nationalistic stance against Cambodia head of the election.  The move has dealt a blow to the progressive People's Party, whose leader Natthaphong Rueangpanyawut had previously pledged not to form any partnership with the conservative party. title: Will the home battery boom slash power bills? | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Demand for home batteries in Australia has taken off, with a generous government subsidy prompting more people to add power storage to their solar panel set up.    More people installed a battery in the second half of last year than during the previous five years.    Renewable power generation also made up half of the nation’s power supply last quarter.   Today, Tony Wood from the Grattan Institute on what the surge in home batteries and renewables in the grid means for everyone’s power bills now and into the future.   Featured:    Tony Wood, Energy and Climate Change Senior Fellow at Grattan Institute

title: Isaac Herzog's visit links Israel's actions with Bondi tensions: Tingle | ABC NEWS
description: Global Affairs Editor Laura Tingle says the visit of Israeli President Isaac Herzog is spotlighting the notion that Israel's actions in the Middle East has escalated tensions against Jewish Australians. title: CFA volunteers speak out about aging firefighting fleets, volunteer shortages | ABC News
description: Out-of-control bushfires tore through Victoria last month, largely fought by an army of volunteers on the front line.  Those volunteer firefighters have for years been raising concerns about old equipment and trucks, and that outcry has become louder after the latest series of blazes.  Elise Kinsella examines what those on the ground are saying, and spoke to Victoria's fire chief Jason Heffernan for this Stateline report. description: Tasmania is planning to toughen up penalties for those caught selling black market tobacco and vapes. The island state has one of Australia's highest smoking rates. title: Milano-Cortina: Career-ending crashes and more medal chances for Australia
description: Lindsey Vonn went into her fifth and final Olympic Winter Games without an ACL, but with her typical determination to compete. While that attitude may have gotten her to the top of her sport, it might also have been her undoing. Plus, medal chances for an Australian on debut and her three-time-Olympic teammate.    Featured: Matt Futterman, senior sports writer, The Athletic. Erin Marsicovetere, ABC SPORT.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Keir Starmer's right-hand-man takes one for his boss | ABC NEWS
description: BBC World Service political correspondent Rob Watson says Morgan McSweeney's resignation as Keir Starmer's chief of staff is a case of taking one for the team. He says it won't be enough to placate the public who are incensed by the ongoing Peter Mandelson-Jeffrey Epstein scandal – one of the biggest in the past 100 years of British history. title: Isaac Herzog takes questions on Israel and antisemitism at Bondi | ABC NEWS
description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog has attended a wreath-laying ceremony at Bondi Pavillion and paid his respects to the victims of the Bondi Beach terror attack.  The event is part of the Israeli politician’s four-day visit to Australia, with the Palestinian Action Group planning mass protests to condemn the Israeli government’s actions in Gaza in the wake of the October 7 attack. In a message to pro-Palestinian protesters, Isaac Herzog identified the demonstrators as opponents of the state of Israel. title: Police granted extra powers as Israeli president visits Australia | ABC NEWS
description: New South Wales Police have been given extra powers as Israeli President Isaac Herzog arrives in Sydney to begin his official visit to Australia following the Bondi Beach terror attack. Under the "major event" declaration, police will have more powers to "close off" access to a major event area and "directing people to leave", Tourism Minister Stephen Kamper said. Protesters are due to gather at Sydney's Town Hall this evening but Assistant Police Commissioner Peter McKenna told ABC News Breakfast police would prefer the group go to the more spacious Hyde Park. More than 3,000 NSW Police officers will be deployed throughout Mr Herzog's visit, including 500 for the planned demonstration tonight. title: Working to save tiny cannibal sea star from extinction | ABC News
description: Volunteers are working hard to try and save a quirky sea star which is at risk of extinction. title: Fair Work hears case for equal pay for young workers | ABC NEWS
description: "Junior pay rates" apply to people below the age of 21 in agreements covering sectors that employ a lot of young people: retail, fast food and pharmacy. A case being heard at the Fair Work Commission could see the abolition of junior pay rates and has unions and corporations at loggerheads. title: WA coast lashed with 155km/h winds from Cyclone Mitchell | ABC NEWS
description: Angus Hines, a senior meteorologist with the Bureau of Meteorology, says that Tropical Cyclone Mitchell has weakened from Category 2 and is now a Category 1. Offshore from the Gascoyne and western Pilbara coastline, the cyclone is continuing to bring heavy rainfall and wind gusts that could exceed 100 km/h, enough to damage property and bring down large branches or trees. Flood watches are in effect, as river levels are expected to rise with additional rainfall as the weather system moves inland.
